translated: The Book of Conditional Relations🔽The Chapter on the Pairs of Doctrinal Terms
The Section on the Pairs of Doctrinal Terms in the Abhidhamma

original: Sāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Anāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naanāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anāsavaṁ dhammaṁ
analyzed: sa āsavam dhammam paṭicca na anāsavaḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā  anāsavam dhammam paṭicca na anāsavaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā anāsavam dhamma
translated: With taints as condition, a phenomenon without taints arises.

original: paṭicca nasāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Anāsavaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nasāsavo🔽ca naanāsavo ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā.
analyzed: paṭicca na sa āsavaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā anāsavam dhammam paṭicca na sa āsavaḥ  ca na anāsavaḥ ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā
translated: With a taintless phenomenon as condition, a phenomenon without taints arises. With a taintless phenomenon as condition, a phenomenon with taints arises. With a taintless phenomenon as condition, a phenomenon with taints arises.

original: Sāsavañca anāsavañca dhammaṁ paṭicca naanāsavo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: sa āsavam ca anāsavam ca dhammam paṭicca na anāsavaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a phenomenon with taints and a taintless phenomenon as condition, a phenomenon without taints arises. (Abbreviated.)

original: Hetuyā pañca, ārammaṇe dve …pe… avigate pañca. (Sabbattha vitthāro.)
analyzed: hetuyā pañca ārammaṇe dve pe avigate pañca sabbattha vitthāro
translated: With a cause as condition, five. With an object as condition, two. … With an absence as condition, five. (In detail.)
